content: cobbles & vines book sleeve crochet pattern by @o_layarn the cobbles & vines book sleeve is a quick and fun crochet pattern to create a cosy and sturdy book sleeve to always have your favourite books with you the stitch used is custom easy and fully explained in the pattern and it requires colour change only once so no worries about having too many ends to weave in it uses little yarn and it s a quick make so it s perfect for destashing and as a gift for your loved ones please feel free to contact me at any time if you need help with this pattern either on instagram at @o_layarn or emailing me at lolla olayarn@gmail com if you enjoy crocheting this book sleeve check out the other patterns that are in my shop and my blog © this pattern is for personal use only and cannot be redistributed in any of its parts you may sell physical products created with this pattern but in small quantities skill level beginner pattern content final sizing - yarn - materials/notions - hooks - construction page 1 stitches and abbreviations page 2 special techniques - gauge page 2 pattern pages 3-4 borders & sewing pages 4-5 flap page 5 flap borders page 6 buttonhole & button page 6 final page 7 tester gallery pages 8-9 final sizing the final piece is 21 cm in length x a circumference of 32 cm if you want to adjust it for your given measurements consider the following each square is 2 cm in width and 2 5 cm in length yarn dk yarn i used prima 100% super soft dk acrylic yarn 100 g/290 m colour a blue in pics 35 g - 100 m colour b sage green in pics 30 g - 90 m materials/notions scissors measuring tape threading needle button hooks note use hook sizes as below or sizes needed to meet gauge 4 5mm crochet hook construction the cobbles & vines book sleeve is crocheted all in one piece creating a piece of fabric that can wrap a book - crocheted bottom up then the three sides are crocheted together leaving the opening at the top at the end a flap is crocheted at the top a button is added together with a buttonhole 1 stitches and abbreviations used ● chain chain ● front post double_crochet fpdc find a quick video here full tutorial below ● right/wrong side rs/ws ● single_crochet* single_crochet ● slip_stitch slip_stitch ● stitch es st s ● turning chain tc - does not count as a stitch ● yarn over yo * tip for a sturdier make crochet the single_crochet with the yarn under instead of yarn over method so insert the hook yarn under pull up a loop pull through two loops this is how i crochet the single_crochet stitches in the tutorials here special techniques front post double_crochet find a quick video here yo and insert your hook behind the single_crochet three row
